Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: tiny storage room

A tiny storage room. It is a square room, about 5 feet on each side. A black walnut trunk is standing against the southern wall. A sturdy, polished amaranth cabinet is standing against the eastern wall.

A tiny storage room. It is a square room, about 5 feet on each side. A black walnut trunk is standing against the southern wall. A sturdy, polished amaranth cabinet is standing against the eastern wall.
a small black walnut door leading west
A small black walnut door leading to a tidy work room to the west. $(parent-desc)
the ceiling
Thick, black walnut joists, sturdy and even, cross the ceiling about eight feet overhead. They support wide wooden planks, which have been plastered and whitewashed.
There seems to be a ceiling overhead in this dark room, supported by thick wooden beams.
Thick, dark wooden joists, sturdy and even, cross the ceiling about eight feet overhead in this dim room. They support wide wooden planks, which have been plastered.
Thick black walnut joists, sturdy and even, cross the ceiling. They support wide wooden planks, which have been plastered and whitewashed.
There seems to be a ceiling not far above your head in this dark room.
This dim room has a ceiling of black walnut beams supporting plastered planks.
the floor
The floor is made from smooth black walnut planks, of various widths. The planks are evenly laid.
The even floor of a dark room is made from smooth wooden planks, of various widths.
The floor of the dim room is made from smooth wooden planks, of various widths.
The floor is made from smooth black walnut planks, of various widths. The planks are evenly laid.
The floor is made from smooth wooden planks, of various widths.
The floor is made from smooth wooden planks, of various widths.
the eastern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall of this dim room is constructed of black walnut posts and diagonal braces, perfectly flat and square -- most are of the same width, though some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of clean, white plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall is constructed of black walnut posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, all perfectly flat and square. The studs are of the same width, though some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of clean, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high.

the western wall

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall of this dim room is constructed of black walnut posts and diagonal braces, perfectly flat and square -- most are of the same width, though some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of clean, white plaster. A black walnut door has been centrally built leading out to the work room.
